attributes.value:
Instructions:
Prepare the Dough:

On a clean surface, make a mound with the flour and create a well in the center.
Crack the eggs into the well, add the olive oil and salt.
Using a fork, gently beat the eggs and gradually incorporate the flour from the edges of the well into the egg mixture.
Knead the Dough:

Once the mixture becomes too thick to mix with a fork, use your hands to continue incorporating the flour.
Knead the dough for about 10 minutes, until it becomes smooth and elastic. If the dough is too dry, add water, one tablespoon at a time. If itâ€™s too sticky, add a little more flour.
Rest the Dough:

Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and let it rest at room temperature for at least 30 minutes.
Roll Out the Dough:

Divide the dough into manageable pieces.
Using a rolling pin or a pasta machine, roll each piece of dough into thin sheets, about 1/16 inch thick.
Cut the Noodles:

Cut the rolled-out dough into long strips about 3-4 inches wide for lasagna noodles.
Lay the noodles on a floured surface or a clean kitchen towel, making sure they do not overlap.
Cook the Noodles:

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Cook the noodles in batches for about 2-3 minutes or until they are al dente.
Remove with a slotted spoon and place them in a bowl of ice water to stop the cooking process.
Drain and lay them out on a clean kitchen towel to dry slightly before assembling your lasagna.

You family gonna love you a'so much more when they eat the Luigi's Classico Lasagna!  They gonna tell you "this the best Luigi's Classico Lasagna! May I have some more, ti prego"
